description: {"blocks":[{"key":"dm2vk","text":"This protocol describes extracting high-molecular-weight DNA from cheese rind microbial community samples. This DNA is suitable for Oxford Nanopore long-read sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"6q9pd","text":"Mortar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f728a","text":"Pestle","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"89suk","text":"Liquid nitrogen","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b4uko","text":"15 mL conical tubes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5jgf7","text":"Centrifuge that is able to cool to 4 °C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cfpuc","text":"Vortexer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7q1uo","text":"50 parent_collections.title: Protocol collection: Sampling and characterizing cheese rind microbial communities

related_materials.name: Proteinase K, Molecular Biology Grade - 2 ml

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"arj3h","text":"Prepare a minimum of 4 mL of Tris Lysis Buffer (TLB) per extraction sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3d6rm","text":"Final concentrations:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3i431","text":"10 mM Tris-Cl, pH 8","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eljr9","text":"100 mM EDTA, pH 8","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fnt7","text":"1% SDS","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"86gio","text":"10 mg/mL lysozyme   ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":18,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4h1o6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":2271,"mol_weight":0,"name":"Lysozyme from chicken egg white","linfor":"","url":"http://www.sigmaaldrich.com/catalog/product/sigma/l6876?lang=en\u0026region=US","sku":"L6876","cas_number":"","rrid":"","public":1,"can_edit":0,"guid":"A69F35F07A8E11ED853B832EAACEBB36","entries":null,"vendor":{"id":17,"name":"Merck MilliporeSigma (Sigma-Aldrich)","link":"http://sigmaaldrich.com","is_requested":false,"image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"emlo9","text":"Cool to room temperature and then add RNase A to a final concentration of 20 μg/mL.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":83,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2809h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":347856,"mol_weight":0,"name":"Monarch RNase A – 1 ml (2x0.5ml)","linfor":"","url":"","sku":"T3018L","cas_number":"","rrid":"","public":1,"can_edit":0,"guid":"FF657FA07A8E11ED853B832EAACEBB36","entries":null,"vendor":{"id":2,"name":"New England Biolabs","link":"https://www.neb.com/","is_requested":false,"image":{"source":"/img/vendors/2.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/2.png"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"23mji","text":"Heat the prepared buffer to 50 °C and vortex periodically until the lysozyme is fully dissolved.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ivki","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bcni4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b20v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"16v28","text":"Dissolving lysozyme at this concentration is time-consuming and requires quite a bit of vortexing. While not validated, it is possible that lower levels of lysozyme may be more ideal.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"511vd","text":"Filter-sterilize the TLB into a sterile container using a 0.22 μm filter.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4a3s8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fec7v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1p0a3","text":"Cool a centrifuge to 4 °C. It should be able to reach 17,000 × g.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"agm43","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3g30a","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b8pbg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bln9q","text":"This protocol describes centrifugation steps using 15 mL conical tubes. You may need to adjust volumes or use different tubes depending on the centrifuge you have available.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fnkg4","text":"Set a water bath or standing incubator to 37 °C and another to 50 °C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b8795","text":"Add 4 mL of prepared TLB to a 15 mL conical tube for each sample being extracted.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"vkm4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6m33o","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c7pi8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2dnea","text":"This volume is for ~250 mg of cheese rind. Adjust volumes as needed depending on the amount of sample.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4isab","text":"Add 250 mg of the harvested cheese rind biofilm into the liquid nitrogen in the mortar and slowly use the pestle to grind the rind. Be careful to not splash the liquid nitrogen out of the mortar when first breaking the sample apart.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fsqek","text":"Add a small amount of liquid nitrogen into the mortar and place the pestle into the mortar to pre-chill.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"etn9g","text":"Keep adding liquid nitrogen followed by grinding until the sample is a fine powder.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a0um6","text":"Transfer the rind powder into the 15 mL conical tube containing 4 mL of TLB and vortex until well mixed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f1rcp","text":"Incubate the tube(s) at 37 °C for 1 h with swirling to mix about every 15 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8r14d","text":"Repeat until all samples are in TLB.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ec6k7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2uuso","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"er6ru","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a5mid","text":"Time required will depend on the number of samples you are processing.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"af9ii","text":"Add 50 μL of Proteinase K and incubate for 1 h at 50 °C with swirling every 15 min.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":83,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bdvbb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":1308,"mol_weight":0,"name":"Proteinase K, Molecular Biology Grade - 2 ml","linfor":"","url":"https://www.neb.com/P8107","sku":"P8107S","cas_number":"","rrid":"","public":1,"can_edit":0,"guid":"2CC807E07B4511ED853B832EAACEBB36","entries":null,"vendor":{"id":2,"name":"New England Biolabs","link":"https://www.neb.com/","is_requested":false,"image":{"source":"/img/vendors/2.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/2.png"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"acile","text":"Add an equal volume (4 mL) of phenol:chloroform:isoamyl alcohol and vortex for five seconds.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":92,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":3958,"mol_weight":0,"name":"UltraPure™ Phenol:Chloroform:Isoamyl Alcohol (25:24:1, v/v)","linfor":"","url":"https://www.thermofisher.com/order/catalog/product/15593031","sku":"15593031","cas_number":"","rrid":"","public":1,"can_edit":0,"guid":"0B3746707A8E11ED853B832EAACEBB36","entries":null,"vendor":{"id":95,"name":"Thermo Fisher Scientific","link":"https://www.thermofisher.com/us/en/home.html","is_requested":false,"image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dbkjs","text":"Rotate on a culture wheel or hula mixer for 10 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"26ji4","text":"Centrifuge for 10 min at 8,000 rpm at 4 °C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a75p8","text":"Transfer the upper aqueous layer to a new 15 mL conical tube without disturbing the interphase.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9ir0k","text":"Add an equal volume of phenol:chloroform:isoamyl alcohol to this aqueous layer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"761av","text":"Rotate on a culture wheel or hula mixer for 10 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"45ka2","text":"Centrifuge for 10 min at 8,000 rpm at 4 °C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"epb1n","text":"Transfer the upper aqueous layer to a new 15 mL conical tube without disturbing the interphase.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ni3s","text":"Repeat steps 19–22 as necessary until the aqueous layer is no longer cloudy. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"985b","text":"After obtaining a clear aqueous layer, add an equal volume of chloroform to this aqueous layer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5cumv","text":"Rotate on a culture wheel or hula mixer for 5 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dbvn3","text":"Centrifuge for 5 min at 8,000 rpm at 4 °C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4kk0g","text":"Transfer the upper aqueous layer to a new 15 mL conical tube without disturbing the interphase.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cgupj","text":"Add an equal volume of ice-cold isopropanol and 0.1 volume of 3 M sodium acetate (sterile) to the aqueous layer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"as9u2","text":"Place at −80 °C for 10 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4s62v","text":"Centrifuge samples at 17,000 × g for 3 min at 4 °C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6p0ah","text":"Remove supernatant, taking care not to remove the pelleted DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"a22qh","text":"Wash pellet with 1 mL ice-cold, 70% ethanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bla5b","text":"Centrifuge samples at 17,000 × g for 3 min at 4 °C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"27q2r","text":"Remove ethanol, taking care not to remove the pelleted DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"225ug","text":"Do a quick spin to pellet any remaining ethanol and remove residual ethanol by pipetting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eo95t","text":"Leave the tube open to dry for about 15 min or until all ethanol has evaporated.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bf9fv","text":"Add 250 μL of molecular biology grade water to the DNA pellet and leave at room temperature overnight. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4tnpl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"68akh","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fa7vq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cv9io","text":"To maximize DNA length, it is best to minimize pipetting of the DNA to avoid shearing. When pipetting, using a pipette tip with the end of the tip cut off to make it wider. This can help decrease shearing.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9qm94","text":"The following day, make sure the DNA is fully resuspended before performing any desired quality checks. If not using immediately, store DNA at −20 °C until needed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8cv5i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"967jc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bqo4f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"395j4","text":"Genomic DNA ScreenTape Analysis on an Agilent Tapestation can help assess quality of genomic DNA. Oxford Nanopore Community pages provide additional recommendations for DNA quality checks to perform prior to ONT sequencing.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"et7s2","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":0},{"key":1,"length":1,"offset":2}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fm11t","text":"    ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dnvbc","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"can_edit":1,"cas_number":"","guid":"E725E1607B4611ED853B832EAACEBB36","id":957966,"linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"Genomic DNA ScreenTape","public":0,"rrid":"","sku":"5067-5365","stats":{"total_protocols":0},"url":"https://www.agilent.com/en/product/automated-electrophoresis/tapestation-systems/tapestation-dna-screentape-reagents/genomic-dna-screentape-analysis-228261","vendor":{"affiliation":null,"affiliations":[],"badges":[],"blocked_by_you":false,"blocked_you":false,"hide_following":false,"id":65,"image":{"placeholder":"https://www.protocols.io/img/vendors/placeholder.png","source":"https://www.protocols.io/img/vendors/placeholder.png"},"is_verified_user":false,"link":"http://www.agilent.com/home","name":"Agilent
